page.title: 04Barnby in the W. The Church
page.content: The Parish Church of All Saints stands at the south east corner of the village close to the River Witham which passes just to the south of the churchyard. There has been a church on the site since at least the tenth century the present one being somewhat unique in that the chancel and the nave are the same length. The Church no longer owns the glebe land or the vicarage, the present vicar living at Coddington some two miles away. Although the average congregation on a Sunday is less than twelve the church is well supported financially and is maintained in a good state of repair. The lower church yard has been allowed to grow wild and provides an excellent habitat for small animals, birds(esp. finches) and butterflies.
